subject: Devo. for Feb. 2
verse: "May you always be filled with the fruit of your Salvation, those good things that are produced in your life by Jesus Christ--for this will bring much glory and praise to God. " (Phil. 1:11)
reflection: The "fruit of salvation" includes all of the character traits flowing from a right relationship with God. there is no other way for us to gain this fruit of righteousness than through Christ. See (Gal. 5:22, 23) for the fruit of the Spirit.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, creator and sustainer of all that exists, I am so thankful that You want to have a relationship with us. I am thankful for the fruit of righteousness that is ours through Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 3

reflection: Many of us if we were imprisoned would become bitter. But Paul saw it as one more opportunity to spread the Good News of Jesus Christ. What have you done with the opportunities you have been given?
prayer: Dear Lord, help me use the opportunities wisely the ways of salvation. . . Amen

subject: Devo for Feb. 4

reflection: When we speak fearlessly for Christ or live faithfully for Him during difficult situations, we encourage others to do the same. Let us be an encouragement by the way that we live.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I know that all believers are called to be witnesses for Christ, please FORGIVE ME for not always being a true encouragement to others. . . Amen.

subject: Devo for Feb. 5

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word, the message of salvation to all who will read, hear, and believe. I pray that Your Spirit would awaken the hearts of all people. . . Amen.

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, my prayer is like that of Paul, that I would always be bold for Christ, even in times of adversity. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 7
verse: Paul says, "You must live in a manner worthy of the Good News about Christ, as citizens of heaven. " (Phil. 1:27)
reflection: Paul encourages the believers of a church to be united as they stand side by side, working together for the Good News. How sad it is that so much time and effort is lost in some churches when fighting with one another takes place instead of uniting against the real opposition! It takes a courageous church to resist infighting and to maintain the common purpose of serving Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be focused on maintaining the common purpose, that of serving Christ. Amen.

subject: Devo for Feb. 8
verse: "For to you it has been granted on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in Him, but also to suffer for His sake. " (Phil. 1:29)
reflection: Paul considered it a privilege to suffer for Christ. Today it isn't part of our nature to think that it is a privilege to suffer. Yet when we suffer, if we faithfully represent Christ, our message and our example affect us and others for good (see Acts 5:41)
prayer: Dear Lord, please forgive me for complaining about the trivial things that happen in my life. I am ashamed when I think of what You went through for my sins. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 9
verse: "Fulfill my joy by being like minded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind. " (Phil. 2:2)
reflection: Many people, even Christians---live only to make a good impression on others or to please themselves. But selfishness brings discord. So Paul stresses spiritual unity, asking the Philippians to love one another and to be one in spirit and purpose. We demonstrate Christ's example when we put others first.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a love, so that I may demonstrate a Christ like example. . . Amen.

subject: Devo for Feb. 10 -- folow-up of Feb. 9
verse: "Let nothing be done through selfish ambition or conceit, but in lowliness of mind let each esteem others better then himself. " (Phil. 2:3)
reflection: Selfishness can ruin a church, but genuine humility can build it. Being humble involves having a true perspective about ourselves (Ro. 12:3). It does not mean that we should put ourselves down. But let us consider the interests of others more important then our own this will link us with Christ who was a true example of humility.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always be mindful of the interests of others as more important then my own, I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 11

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to consider the feelings of others, thus being a positive witness for my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would guide my every thought so that my attitude would be pleasing to You. I pray this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 17

LET US SHINE OUT FOR GOD.
prayer: Forgive me Lord, when my life doesn't shine as it should for You Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 20
verse: Whatever happens, dear brothers and sisters, may the Lord give you joy, I never get tired of telling you this. I am doing this for your own good. (Phil. 3:1)

subject: Devo. for Feb. 21
verse: "We who worship God in the Spirit, are the only ones who are truly circumcised. We put no confidence in human efforts. Instead, we boast about what Christ Jesus has done for us." (Phil. 3:3)
reflection: It is easy to place more emphases on human effort then on eternal faith, but God values the attitude of our heart above all else. Don't judge people's spirituality by their fulfillment of duties or by their level of human activity. And don't think that you satisfy God by feverishly doing His work. God notices all you do for Him and will reward you for it, BUT only if it comes as a loving response to His free gift of salvation.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I truly thank You for what Christ Jesus has done for us. I pray that the attitude of my heart would always be pleasing to You. . . Amen.

subject: Devo for Feb. 22
verse: Verses 4-6 give us some insight as to Paul's prior life before he came face to face with Christ, on the road as he was on his way to arrest more Christians. He was so sure of his self righteousness that he was willing to match his life with the life of any Pharisees. After his meeting with Christ a definite change took place in him. this is his statement after meeting with Christ, "What a priceless gain of knowing Christ."
reflection: Is this your testimony? Or like the old Paul are you depending upon your good works? A religion without faith in the finished work of Christ is a religion without any hope of eternal life. . .
prayer: I thank You Lord, for the promise of eternal life that is ours by faith in our Lord Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 23

subject: Devo. for Feb. 24
verse: "Yes everything else is worthless when compared with the priceless gain of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. I have discarded everything else, counting it all garbage, so that I may have Christ." (Phil. 3:8)

A person's relationship with Christ is more important than anything else. Is it time to reconsider your values? If your priorities are wrong, how will you reorder them?
prayer: Dear Lord, help me each day to prioritize my values, so that I will regain a correct perspective of my relationship with my Savior. . . Amen.

subject: Devo for Feb. 25
verse: (follow up of vs. 8) "I no longer count on my own goodness or my own ability to obey God's law, but I trust Christ to save me. For God's way of making us right with Himself depends on faith." (Phil. 3:9)
reflection: No amount of law-keeping, self-improvement, discipline, or religious effort can make us right with God. Righteousness comes only from God. We are made righteous (receive right-standing with Him) by trusting in Christ. He exchanges our sin and short-comings for His complete righteousness.
prayer: Dear Lord, I must thank You once again for all that You have done for me through the sacrifice of Your Son, to pay for my sins. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 26 (follow-up of 25)
verse: "As a result, I can really know Christ and experience the mighty power that raised Him from the dead. I can learn what it means to suffer with Him, sharing in His death." (Phil. 3:10)
reflection: Paul gave up everything - family, friendship, and freedom - in order to know Christ and His resurrection power. We too, have access to this knowledge and this power, but we may have to make sacrifices to enjoy it fully. What ever it is, knowing Christ is more than worth the sacrifice.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that Your crucifixion marks the death of my old sinful nature. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 27
verse: " I strain to reach the end of the race and receive the prize for which God, through Christ Jesus, is calling us up to heaven." (Phil 3:14)
reflection: If our hope is in Christ, we can let go of past guilt and look forward to what God will help us become. Don't dwell on your past, instead, grow in the knowledge of God by concentrating on your relationship with Him now.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would continue to grow in the knowledge of my Heavenly Father and also grow in a deeper relationship with Him through the guidance of the Holy Spirit. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Feb. 28
verse: Paul's advice: "Mature Christians, must be sure to obey the truth you have already learned. " (Phil. 3:15a &16a)
reflection: Christian maturity involves acting on the guidance that you have already received. We can always make excuses that we still have much to learn. But the instructions to us is to live up to what we already know and live out what we have already learned. We do not have to be sidetracked. by an unending search for the truth.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that Your Spirit would help me to continue growing in my knowledge of You. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Mar. 1
verse: "We are citizens of heaven where Jesus Christ lives. And we are eagerly waiting for Him to return as our Savior. " (Phil. 3:20)
reflection: One day every born again Christian will experience all the special privileges of our heavenly citizenship because we belong to Christ. Let us not be so tide to this life that we would be sorry to see Christ return.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I am so grateful that Christ paid for my sins so I now have a place in heaven already prepared for me. . . Amen.
